title: Ailred has had a potent attraction for monastic and other scholars. A catalogue raisonne of his writings and of discussions of his life and works is given by Sir Maurice Powicke in his edition of Walter Daniel's Life in Nelson's Medieval Classics
Anima and Sermones inediti with valuable introductions, and numerous studies of his spiritual and ethical doctrine have appeared in the Revue Benedictine and the Cistercian periodicals
